alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 18 at 11:24AM PST until January 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: .A long duration atmospheric river event is forecast to bring 2 to 5 inches of rain to the region from Friday night through Monday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING, JANUARY 20 THROUGH MONDAY MORNING, JANUARY 22... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Oregon including the Curry County Coast. This is roughly from port Orford south to the California state line. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Monday, January 29. * IMPACTS...Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. Flooding may occur in poorly draining low-lying areas and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. As well as flooding concerns, this rainfall could also lead to increased occurrences of rockfalls and land slides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Excessive rainfall on already saturated soils, leading to increased runoff into already high creeks, streams, and rivers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
